duties_responsibilities.duty: Own the site’s indirect procurement operation responsibilities, including forecasting, inventory management, purchase order management, and Vendor management of 3rd party service providers.
Lead supplier management KPI and metrics reporting, and work with stakeholders to find and understand deviation and improvement areas.
Provide procurement leadership and align with the building leadership team to drive efficiencies and improvements at the site(s).
Develop relationship across the building and network to ensure best practices are being shared and implemented.
Manage KPI to measure, control, and benchmark procurement processes including creation of recurring metrics reports to drive improvements for the Operations network.
Coordinate the demand identification, procurement, and inventory management of all non-merchandise items required for building operation.
Partner with Category team to manage and maintain supplier scorecards.
Support the procurement operations and category management teams.
Ensure timely resolution of vendor payment issues.
Lead team of non-inventory receivers to ensure building has adequate resources and is set up for success.
Develop deep knowledge of non-inventory items and align with like buildings to drive best practices.
Work in partnership both internally and with suppliers to develop innovative solutions to provide Procurement support to the Operations network.
Develop and implement ways to measure suppliers to drive continuous performance improvement on behalf of the organization.
Measure actual vs planned savings; as savings trends are identified, own action plans to meet goals and develop solutions.
Work is done in a warehouse environment that requires frequent walking around the building.

education_certification.credential: Bachelor's degree, or 2+ years of Amazon (blue badge/FTE) experience
